item.title: Report X-2024071519
item.description:
Report X-2024071519

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-24T15:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Package consists of a fiberboard box containing 4 plastic bottles, each in a plastic bag. One of the caps was either very loose or defective, as it came off completely during inspection. Contents were not contained by the plastic bag, and leaked out, ruining the box. The spill reached a section of rollers and 1 other known package (777213356566). Spill area was covered in neutralizing absorbent powder, then swept and then contained in a lined salvage bin.

item.title: Report X-2024071287
item.description:
Report X-2024071287

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-15
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Fiberboard box containing 4 plastic bottles of granular solid laundry detergent. Package was found by a load do with a flap of the box extruding and ripped. Upon inspection, one of the bottles was found to be sideways and missing the cap. Due to the solid nature of the contents, a minimal amount spilled from the bottle, and only traces could be found within the box and on other bottles within. The cap appears to have been broken, as a small part of the side of the cap was located inside the box as well.

item.title: Report E-2024070401
item.description:
Report E-2024070401

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-19T18:15:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-22
  • City: BESSEMER
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 10000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 100-gallons of Sulfuric acid released from one (1) 275-gallon tote onto the trailer floor and asphalt underneath the trailer. The Tote was punctured on the bottom by a forklift during unloading, releasing to the trailer interior and onto the dock and parking lot. ERTS dispatched Hepaco to the site to assist with clean up. The contractor arrived on-site and confirmed the product affected a 20’x4’ area on the trailer floor and underneath the trailer floor. The contractor collected and containerized the Dilute Sulfuric Acid (35%) and all clean-up debris into six (6) 55-gallon drums and one (1) 275-gallon tote. All waste was stored onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
